summary: This is a search warrant and motion to seal filed in the U.S. District Court for the District of New Hampshire. It authorizes the search of a 156-acre property where Ghislaine Maxwell is believed to be present, and her seizure for charges including conspiracy, enticement of minors, transportation of minors, and perjury. The government moves to seal the entire matter to prevent compromising the ongoing investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Target Subject of investigation, person to be seized
persons.context: The primary target of the search warrant, believed to be present at the subject premises. She is to be arrested for violations including conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, and perjury.

persons.name: Andrea K. Johnstone
persons.context: The judge who issued the search warrant and granted the motion to seal the related documents.

persons.name: Scott W. Murray
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who respectfully submitted the motion to seal the search warrant application and related documents.

persons.name: John S. Davis
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney who signed and filed the motion to seal on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Murray, as U.S. Attorney, is the prosecuting authority seeking the warrant for Maxwell's arrest and seizure.
Davis, as Assistant U.S. Attorney, filed the motion to seal the warrant application targeting Maxwell.
Judge Johnstone issued the warrant authorizing the search for and seizure of Maxwell.
Davis is an Assistant U.S. Attorney working under or with U.S. Attorney Murray on the case.

events.title: Search Warrant Issued for Maxwell's Property
events.description: A U.S. Magistrate Judge issued a warrant authorizing the search of a 156-acre New Hampshire property and the seizure of Ghislaine Maxwell for multiple federal charges.

events.title: Motion to Seal Warrant Filed
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office filed a motion to seal the entire search warrant application and related documents for 180 days to prevent compromising the investigation.

events.title: Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The warrant commanded execution on or before this date.

locations: 156-acre property located in the District of New Hampshire (exact address not provided in text)
Main residence, guesthouse, and garage on the subject premises
United States District Court for the District of New Hampshire
keyFacts: A federal search warrant was issued on July 2, 2020, for a 156-acre property in New Hampshire where Ghislaine Maxwell was believed to be present.
The warrant authorized the seizure of Maxwell for charges including conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
The government moved to seal the entire warrant application and related documents, citing that premature release could cause Maxwell to flee, destroy evidence, or change her behavior.
The warrant was issued by U.S. Magistrate Judge Andrea K. Johnstone based on a finding of probable cause.
The motion to seal was granted, with the seal set to expire on December 31, 2020.
